commands: [[ -z $(opkg list-installed | grep -q 'onion-dt-overlay-sw-spi') ]] && export RESULT='The package has been installed' || export RESULT='Not found'
[[ $RESULT=='Not found' ]] && [[ -z $(opkg install onion-dt-overlay-sw-spi | grep -q 'Configuring onion-dt-overlay-sw-spi') ]] && RESULT='The package has been installed'
if_failed:
Check if needed kernel modules are installed (kmod-mmc-spi, kmod-spi-bitbang, kmod-spi-dev, kmod-spi-gpio) with 'opkg list-installed' command. 
Also see https://documentation.onioniot.com/device-tree-overlay/intro.

commands: [[ -z $(opkg list-installed | grep -q 'onion-dt-overlay-w1-gpio') ]] && export RESULT='The package has been installed' || export RESULT='Not found'
[[ $RESULT=='Not found' ]] && [[ -z $(opkg install onion-dt-overlay-w1-gpio | grep -q 'Configuring onion-dt-overlay-w1-gpio') ]] && RESULT='The package has been installed'
if_failed:
Check if needed kernel modules are installed (kmod-w1, kmod-w1-master-gpio, kmod-w1-slave-therm) with 'opkg list-installed' command. 
Also see https://documentation.onioniot.com/device-tree-overlay/intro.

1. Check if '/lib/firmware/device-tree/overlays/sw-spi.dtbo' exists.
2. Check if configfs is mounted 'mount | grep configfs'.
3.Reboot the device.
Double check kernel modules kmod-mmc-spi, kmod-spi-bitbang, kmod-spi-dev, kmod-spi-gpio with 'opkg list-installed' command.

1. Check if '/lib/firmware/device-tree/overlays/w1-gpio.dtbo' exists.
2. Check if configfs is mounted 'mount | grep configfs'.
3.Reboot the device.
Double check kernel modules kmod-w1, kmod-w1-master-gpio, kmod-w1-slave-therm presence with 'opkg list-installed' command.
